reviews.text: Views are great if you stay at the top. Rooms were shabby (no lights and hot water when we arrived but problems were resolved quickly) and not secure as the windows have no real locking capability. Breakfast was not great and rather small portioned so we went up the road to the cafe which was excellent.
reviews.title: Great views, shabby rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Watch the step out of the lift on the ground floor...
reviews.title: Skating by on Travel Guide reviews

reviews.text: Cat Cat View Hotel was such a disappointment! We stayed there because it had been recommended in both Frommer's and Lonely Planet, and it felt like the staff stopped caring about guests soon after the publishing dates. A few notes from our 2-night stay:
reviews.title: Take the higher levels... the view is the best in town.

reviews.text: 1. The views are amazing. And I hope you like stairs, because the elevator was out of service during most of our stay, so we were required to climb eight flights to get to our room.
reviews.title: Good value, lovely people, wonderful view

reviews.text: 2. There's a fireplace in the room, but no wood. When you ask for wood, they will say no because it is "too smokey".
reviews.title: Cannot recognise the reviews below!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews say it all- Great views, horrible, cold, old rooms. Good breakfast and way overcharged for tours compared to other agencies. Local Hmung girls get $5 for a $45 4 hour tour.... Driver gets $5 for a 2 hour tour costing $25. Other hotels provide free transpo back to Lau Ci, they charge..... linens, blankets old and beat up.... Excellent views though....
reviews.title: too many other choices !!!

reviews.text: The Cat Cat View Hotel was the first place we stayed in Vietnam and it was a great introduction to the country. The views from the patio right outside our room were amazing. It got us psyched up for our hike of Mt. Fancy Pants.
reviews.title: Great staff and great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our favorite part about the hotel was the random dance class we stumbled on one evening. Some older guy was teaching a group of woman all kinds of dances. It was really fun to watch, and they loved it when we joined in.
reviews.title: Avoid this one!

reviews.text: Our room was nice and clean, nothing fancy, but nice nonetheless. I'm not sure how it compares to other places in Sapa, but we were certainly happy with it. As well, the daily breakfast they serve wasn't anything spectacular, but it was good.
reviews.title: Great Views

reviews.text: Overall the Cat Cat View was a nice place to stay in Sapa and I would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

reviews.text: The Hotel is in a fantastic Location, Staff were extremely nice, Restaurant was good. We also arranged a local tour and a 5 day tour across northern Vietnam through the hotel. Both fantastic and very well priced as we had quotes elsewhere much higher. Highly Recommend both the hotel and their tours. We had Khanh on our 5 day tour and my kids still talk about him and miss him.
reviews.title: Fantastic Views, Great Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice place, just 100 m walk from the local market, in the right corner of the small town. Some rooms (I think the 5th floor and up) have a beautiful view. The acceptably friendly receptionist arranged a one-day walking guide, but this H'mong-woman also brought 5 of her friends, who all tried to sell us something during the walks.
reviews.title: A nice but somewhat crowded place

reviews.text: The rooms are not very luxurious, and the doors are thin. We heard the noisy people on the other side of the hall. There was no hot water when we arrived but is was fixed quickly. The breakfast was not good. However, the whole atmosphere in Cat Cat View is a little 'backpacking' hostel and nice and convenient.
reviews.title: Best Views Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a memorable stay in Sapa. The views from the room were amazing. The only problem we had was with the air conditioner which leaked water into the television when it had been running for a while so we had to do without.
reviews.title: Great Views Don't Compensate for Lousy Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were not overly friendly and power outages are quite common but no point grumbling about that......just carry a torch.
reviews.title: Mail posted to Guide at Hotel Mysteriously Never Arrives?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't even know where to start. We had confirmed our reservation weeks before arriving via emails, but when we got there the woman told us that she had given our suite (top floor penthouse apartment) away because, she said, we had never confirmed by email that we wanted it. My wife actually had the email in her bag, and when she showed it to the woman, she said she had never seen it. The woman's card said the same name as the person whom signed the email, and when we said "Look, your name is at the bottom of the page" she said that was not her. Then I said "why is that the name on your card you just gave me?" she said she had given me the wrong card. So she had given the room away to some other people. Like that was not bad enough, it gets worse.
reviews.title: Most dishonest hotel I have ever been in. Old and dirty too.

reviews.text: She gives us another room, which is tiny and smelled very musty. We had been travelling for over 24 hours and wanted a shower. The woman, same one, said the plumbing was just being repaired and we would have to wait 1.5 hours until we could have a shower. 8 hours later there was still no water, I talked to some other lodgers two floors down and they said the water had been off since the day before!!! I told her that we were going to just go stay at another hotel because we really wanted a shower, she said that all of Sapa had no water! She tried to tell me that there was only one reservoir for the whole town and since there was barely any rainfall this year, the water got turned off all the time! Can you beleive this? Funny, all the restaurants seemed to have water for cooking and cleaning.
reviews.title: faulty plumbing and lost laundry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suddenly, she said that the rooms in the other part of the hotel did have water. We had to carry our bags up like ten levels of steps and stairs to some other part of the hotel past the restaurant to another type of room. I don't even know if the two buildings were connected. Well it had water all right, it just had no shower curtain, no power in most of the plugs, the TV was broken, there were just two facecloths with rips that were our bath towels (I am not kidding here), the soap was not new, the tub leaked out the bottom all over the floor, the toilet didn't flush properly, and there were some sort of little bugs in the one bed. We slept in our clothes on top of the comforter. There was some sort of broken roofing above us because whenever the wind picked up you could hear sheet metal banging together, like the sound you hear when air ducts bang when a house is under construction.
reviews.title: Memorable Experience

reviews.text: The next morning I ran into the guys who had been there the day before, they still had no running water. I asked them why they were still there and they said because they had paid ahead of time on the internet and the woman would not give them their money back and they were on a tight budget so they could not just go stay somehwere else.
reviews.title: Ok hotel and room. Oh so cold, mind that gap and book your own guide.

reviews.text: I think this is perhaps the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I have stayed in some really low end places, but at least they were honest, and you knew what you were getting yourself into for $10 per night. Not like this place for $50. The dishonesty was the part that really made it bad. These are just bad people, period.
reviews.title: Great view, average room and tours!
